Question
========

Suppose it is given that for a given patient population, the hemoglobin (Hb) level is normally distributed with μ = 14.6 and σ = 0.4. We randomly draw one person from this population. How high should the Hb of this person be at most to belong to the lowest 20% of the population? belong?

Answerlist
----------

* 14.2634
* 14.4335
* 14.6941
* 14.8008

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 14.2634: Correct
* 14.4335: Incorrect
* 14.6941: Incorrect
* 14.8008: Incorrect
